comments.body: @andrewsykim updated! PTAL
This probably needs a comment for why we're skipping the provider ID check when instance v2 is enabled.

@andrewsykim gotcha! 
updated the notes
is this call expensive? should we only call it if `node.Spec.ProviderID == ""`
`InstancesV2` like `Instances` should only return an implementation of an interface and a bool for whether it's supported so it's fairly cheap.
thanks. looks like this already has approval from package owners.
@liggitt looks like this PR still have `do-not-merge` label so it cannot get merged, I think maybe it needs approval from Release Manager, can you help with it? :)
@andrewsykim updated, PTAL
I think we want the AddFunc and UpdateFunc event handleres on line 147 and 148 to enqueue node objects to the workqueue, and likewise `syncHandler` should call `UpdateCloudNode` as well.
same
Is it necessary for us to still call kubeclient api to list nodes?  we can just get all nodes info from the cache(nodelisterner).

Don't think so, we can probably update this to list nodes from the informer cache as well.

comments.body: I think we actually want the GCE network unavailable condition to happen before the Update on line 442, since we want the condition in place before the cloud provider init taint is removed. Otherwise there will be a brief period where the node doesn't have the cloud taint and the condition.

@andrewsykim The unit tests would fail if I move GCE network unavailable condition to happen before the **Update**
Not sure why it causes the error, still investigating ðŸ¤”

FYI @cheftako we should probably discuss getting rid of this custom check for GCE, I can't recall the initial reason behind the GCE specific check. Would probably be nice to have something generic here.

+1. Most of these checks are because the test needs something which wasn't generally available. Not sure about this particular test but I've written a few of these. Its frequently something like the webhook tests. You need to create a special test container and deploy it to your registry. The intention was always that other cloud providers would follow adding the container to their registry.
nice :)

Can we actually go one step further. With the current change, you still be calling GetInstanceMetadata twice:
- in getNodeModifiersFromCloudProvider
- here

Can we actually call GetInstanceMetadata in this function and pass it to those two functions?
Yes, I have thought it. But I'd rather do it as a follow-up work, since this is large enough and tests need to be addressed.
OK, cool. Can you please add a TODO so that we won't forget about it?
Sure.
Added.
